results.title: Going to Nan & Pop's Farm
results.creator_credit: Candice Jones and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’. Candice recounts the fond memories of visiting her grandparents’ flower farm. This story is told with animated illustrations, photographs and video footage.

results.title: The Impact
results.creator_credit: Ross Onley-Zerkel and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’. Ross tells of the traumatic experience of being the victim of a drink driving car crash and the repercussions that event has had on his life thereafter.

results.title: My Life with Epilepsy
results.brief_description: Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’. Jodi tells of her family history with epilepsy and her personal journey as the condition began to affect her life.

results.title: Birth without knives
results.brief_description:
Please note: This film contains footage of a home birth, including nudity.

Created by ‘Asphyxia’, this film talks about the concerns regarding pregnancy, avoiding a caesarean birth and having a home birth.

Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’.

results.title: The Naked Artist
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Robert Rosmarin
results.brief_description:
A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop Telling Tales. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for Telling Tales.
Robert Rosmarin talks of the sometimes chaotic family-life of his childhood, reaching a climax with a tragic car accident which claimed the life of his mother. He talks about his on and off relationship with art, including participating in Spencer Tunick’s iconic crowd nude photographs taken on Princes Bridge in Melbourne.
results.description:
A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop Telling Tales. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for Telling Tales.

He talks about his on and off relationship with art, including participating in Spencer Tunick’s iconic crowd nude photographs taken on Princes Bridge in Melbourne.

results.title: The Crying Game
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and John Wood
results.brief_description:
A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop Telling Tales. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for Telling Tales.
This story made by John Wood talks about his uncontrallable bouts of crying. This is sometimes brought about by depression or anxiety. He has learned that the expression of emotion is very healthy.

results.title: Kyara
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Hank Kerr
results.brief_description:
A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop Telling Tales. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for Telling Tales.
This film is a message from Hank Kerr to his daughter, Kyara. It speaks about his alcoholism and determination to become a better person for the sake of his daughter. Kerr also talks about the jobs he has had including as a clown in the first Aboriginal Clown troop called the Oogadee Boogadees.
results.description:
A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop Telling Tales. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for Telling Tales.

results.title: [Remix: Historic Melbourne]
results.brief_description:
This video was created using footage from the ACMI Collection.

The remix features trams and historic landmarks in the City of Melbourne. Selected locations include the Princes Bridge, Flinders Street Station, corner of Spring and Bourke Street, intersection of Flinders and Swanston Street, ‘South Melb’ tram, Flinders Street Station Clocktower from Elizabeth Street, St Paul’s Cathedral, Forum Theatre, ‘Melbourne Public Library’ (State Library of Victoria) and the banks of the Yarra River.
results.description:
